Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of deaths in the knife attack, stating that eight Americans died when in fact only the attacker was killed.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no Americans died in the knife attack.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it falsely states that eight Americans died without providing any evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the knife attack was carried out by a "Somalian refugee" without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Understate: The claim understates the severity of the knife attack by falsely stating that no one died when in fact the attacker was killed.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the knife attack, such as the motive or background of the attacker.
